reason: Conflicting signals from regulatory discussions and internal industry disagreements (Coinbase's stance, Senate calls, internal rejections) create short-term uncertainty and potential volatility. This regulatory overhang could lead to choppy price action. However, the foundational moves by DTCC to digitize all securities and Goldman Sachs's explicit focus on crypto underscore strong long-term institutional adoption and integration. This suggests that any price dips due to regulatory FUD may be met with significant buying pressure, indicative of smart money accumulation. Prudence is advised pending clearer regulatory signals, but the long-term outlook remains bullish due to institutional buy-in.
headlines: Tokenization firms reject Coinbase's crypto bill equities claims
Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong says company opposed crypto bill to protect consumers
DTCC aiming to make all 1.4 million securities in its custody digitally eligible
Senate Democrats pursuing a Friday call with crypto industry on market structure bill
Goldman is 'spending a lot of time' on crypto, prediction markets efforts, CEO Solomon says
